intro: Serjania meridionalis var. cuezzoi, commonly known as the Brazilian serjania, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
